com.ibm.cs.service

Class ProductManagementService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.cs.service.ProductManagementService

  • public class ProductManagementService
extends java.lang.Object
    Service class to handle all inventory-related logic.
    Handles CRUD operations for Category, Product, Batch, and Item
    Author:
    Dan Alejandro A. Vargas
    See Also:
    Category, Product, Batch, Item

    • Method Detail

      • getInventory

        public java.util.ArrayList<Category> getInventory()
        builds the Inventory. Inventory has following structure:
        - root is a list of categories, e.g. (toothpaste)
        - each category has list of products, e.g. (Colgate-White variant-150ml under toothpaste category)
        - each product has list of batches, e.g. (1 shipment of Colgate-White-150ml toothpaste containing 100 items)
        - each batch has list of items, e.g. (item of type Colgate-White-150ml toothpaste with own expiry and manufacture date)

        4 separate database tables are involved in the inventory (tables for category, product, batch, item). I wanted to avoid a 4-table join or repetitive queries. Instead, each table is queried once, and then organized into the hierarchical structure using HashMaps. I chose HashMaps for constant-time O(1) insert and search/get.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Categories which represents the whole inventory

      • getItemList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Item> getItemList()
        Gets arraylist of all items from the item DAO
        Returns:

      • getBatchMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Batch> getBatchMap()

        Returns:
        HashMap(key = batch id, value = Batch object) containing all batches in the database
        See Also:
        Batch, BatchDAO

      • getProductMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Product> getProductMap()

        Returns:
        HashMap(key = product id, value = Product object) containing all products in the database
        See Also:
        Product, ProductDAO

      • getCategoryMap

        See Also:
